sanavesa.net

Class DisconnectClientPacket

  • java.lang.Object
    • sanavesa.net.DisconnectClientPacket
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, NetworkSerializable

    final class DisconnectClientPacket
extends java.lang.Object
implements NetworkSerializable
    The DisconnectClientPacket class is a special packet type that is used internally to disconnect clients from the server.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Mohammad Alali
    See Also:
    NetworkSerializable, Server, Client

      The generated UID of the packet.

      This method is invoked whenever the server requests for client to disconnect.

      This method is invoked whenever the client requests for server to disconnect.

    • Method Detail

      • handleOnClient

        public <T extends Client> void handleOnClient(T client)
        This method is invoked whenever the server requests for client to disconnect. This is called on the client's machine that was kicked by the server.
        Specified by:
        handleOnClient in interface NetworkSerializable
        Type Parameters:
        T - - the class type of the client who received this object
        Parameters:
        client - - the client who got kicked by the server
        Since:
        1.1
        See Also:
        Client

      • handleOnServer

        public <T extends Server> void handleOnServer(T server,
                                              ServerClient sender)
        This method is invoked whenever the client requests for server to disconnect. This is called on the server's machine.
        Specified by:
        handleOnServer in interface NetworkSerializable
        Type Parameters:
        T - - the class type of the server who received this object
        Parameters:
        server - - the server who read this serializable object
        sender - - the client who wants to disconnect
        Since:
        1.1
        See Also:
        Server
